channel.title: Rules need to be made clear
channel.description:
I just played a game where i was merc. Cult were clearly losing badly, there was 2 cult left. My target just got converted and he told me about it. I decided to out him, so that i could get a new target and win with BD. I did that and easily won with BD If i didn't do that, i would surely have lost.
After the game, someone said he reported me for game throwing. I kinda laughed at him saying that i won the game.
But i went on discord to ask the mods, and to my surprise, its against the rules
They said that merc's win condition is protecting his target, so what i did is "game throwing".
So my request is, make the rules more clear before banning people for unclear rules.
I understand that mercs betraying their contract can be "Unfun", and could be made a rule, but it REALLY does not fit in "game throwing", because what i did in my mind is the exact opposite of game throw. It was actually a really clever move that made me win for sure.

item.title: Rules need to be made clear
item.dc:creator: robflop
item.description:
Okay, here’s our official statement:

If you are a Mercenary, you are expected to do everything to make sure your contract at any given time survives. Furthering their doom at any point in time is gamethrowing. If they’re going to die anyway, just keep quiet and not make it worse. Then get your 2nd contract and move on.

This means: Outing your 1st contract as Mercenary because they will die is gamethrowing. If you know they are going to die, don’t make it worse – but you can just wait until they die when there is nothing else you can do to help them and then get a second contract.

Also, if you go from Merc to King, then your win condition changes to just surviving (Neutral King), meaning you are allowed to Out your contracts after becoming the Neutral King.

Edit: The below post, about bussing only being accepted when it is with the consent of the respective players, is also valid. Bussing not accepted by the Person subjected to the buss is seen as outing your teammates intentionally.

item.description:
Yes its “game throwing” according to the mods. here is the main argument i told them:

I said that your win condition as merc is to see one of your targets survive. So if you know for sure that the first one is not gonna survive, its by your win condition to start working for the future target. But apparently that’s against the rules.

But the mods were nice and accepted to remove my violation. I told them i now understand the merc rule.
